\/D:\/repos\/rr\/source\/ReleaseNotes\/R: Xenko release 1.8 introduces three major new features along with several relevant enhancements to existing features.
Xenko release 1.8 introduces three major new features along with several relevant enhancements to existing features.
We are proud to be able to offer you our new <g1>UI Editor</g1>, enhanced performance via our newly <g2>multithreaded engine</g2> with Vulkan support and our new <g3>Prefab Model</g3>.
We are proud to be able to offer you our new <g1>UI Editor</g1>, enhanced performance via our newly <g2>multithreaded engine</g2> with Vulkan support and our new <g3>Prefab Model</g3>.
Also, for your cutting edge rendering needs, we now support <g1>SSAO</g1> and <g2>cel (toon) shading</g2>!
Also, for your cutting edge rendering needs, we now support <g1>SSAO</g1> and <g2>cel (toon) shading</g2>!
This release introduces new UI assets along with a brand-new UI editor, so that you can create amazing UI directly from the Game Studio!
This release introduces new UI assets along with a brand-new UI editor, so that you can create amazing UI directly from the Game Studio!
The UI editor provides a full WYSIWYG experience.
The UI editor provides a full WYSIWYG experience.
You can author the whole visual tree of your UI, edit the properties of each UI element (such as layout, background color, etc.) and preview its rendering.
You can author the whole visual tree of your UI, edit the properties of each UI element (such as layout, background color, etc.) and preview its rendering.
<g1>UI Page asset</g1>: represents a typical tree of UI elements that can assigned to the UI Component of an entity in the scene or prefab editor.
<g1>UI Page asset</g1>: represents a typical tree of UI elements that can assigned to the UI Component of an entity in the scene or prefab editor.
<g1>UI Library asset</g1>: represents a collection of UI trees (similar to prefabs) that can be reused by other UI Pages.
<g1>UI Library asset</g1>: represents a collection of UI trees (similar to prefabs) that can be reused by other UI Pages.
UIComponent now expects a UI Page.
UIComponent now expects a UI Page.
A UI Library is useful to create or edit UI at runtime.
A UI Library is useful to create or edit UI at runtime.
And since it is built on the same system as archetypes and prefabs, you can easily create shared UI parts, override some properties and have changes propagating automatically.
And since it is built on the same system as archetypes and prefabs, you can easily create shared UI parts, override some properties and have changes propagating automatically.
Many computationally intensive systems have been multithreaded.
Many computationally intensive systems have been multithreaded.
Expect a major increase in performance and better scaling to correspond with the size of your game!
Expect a major increase in performance and better scaling to correspond with the size of your game!
We have observed up to 6 times higher frame rates for heavily CPU bound scenes so far (on a typical 4-core CPU).
We have observed up to 6 times higher frame rates for heavily CPU bound scenes so far (on a typical 4-core CPU).
Parallelized code includes many <g1>EntityProcessors</g1> and almost every part of our recently rewritten <g2>rendering pipeline</g2>.
Parallelized code includes many <g1>EntityProcessors</g1> and almost every part of our recently rewritten <g2>rendering pipeline</g2>.
On <g3>Vulkan</g3> and <g4>Direct3D12</g4> this includes also recording of drawing command lists, giving them an edge over the other APIs.
On <g3>Vulkan</g3> and <g4>Direct3D12</g4> this includes also recording of drawing command lists, giving them an edge over the other APIs.

Developers can find classes and utilities for concurrent programming in the <g1>SiliconStudio.Core.Threading</g1> namespace, e.g. <g2>Dispatcher.For()</g2>, which resemble the Task Parallel Library, but are more lightweight and tailored for work performed every frame in a game's update loop.

Developers can find classes and utilities for concurrent programming in the <g1>SiliconStudio.Core.Threading</g1> namespace, e.g. <g2>Dispatcher.For()</g2>, which resemble the Task Parallel Library, but are more lightweight and tailored for work performed every frame in a game's update loop.
Over time, we will look into multithreading more parts of the engine, including independent subsystems, such as different phases of the <g1>RenderSystem</g1> and <g2>Scripts</g2>.
Over time, we will look into multithreading more parts of the engine, including independent subsystems, such as different phases of the <g1>RenderSystem</g1> and <g2>Scripts</g2>.
The Prefab Model is a new type of Model asset that generates an optimized baked and merged single model from a prefab.
The Prefab Model is a new type of Model asset that generates an optimized baked and merged single model from a prefab.
It merges meshes together by material and vertex layout.
It merges meshes together by material and vertex layout.
You can easily go from thousands of draw calls to one or two draw calls.
You can easily go from thousands of draw calls to one or two draw calls.
To use it, just create a new Prefab Model asset from the Game Studio and assign a prefab to it.
To use it, just create a new Prefab Model asset from the Game Studio and assign a prefab to it.
Make sure that the base prefab is just containing static entities as only <g1>ModelComponent</g1> types are merged.
Make sure that the base prefab is just containing static entities as only <g1>ModelComponent</g1> types are merged.
Ambient Occlusion was added to the list of post-processing effects.
Ambient Occlusion was added to the list of post-processing effects.
The current technique implements <g1>Scalable Ambient Obscurance</g1>.
The current technique implements <g1>Scalable Ambient Obscurance</g1>.
It exposes a variety of options, including number of tap samples, intensity, tap radius and back buffer size.
It exposes a variety of options, including number of tap samples, intensity, tap radius and back buffer size.
It is currently part of the post-effect pipeline, but will later move to the lighting pipeline for more realistic rendering.
It is currently part of the post-effect pipeline, but will later move to the lighting pipeline for more realistic rendering.
Cel shading (or Toon shading) is now available as a rendering model with both Diffuse and Specular rendering options.
Cel shading (or Toon shading) is now available as a rendering model with both Diffuse and Specular rendering options.
The default implementation limits the light product to binary or 3-cuts discrete levels.
The default implementation limits the light product to binary or 3-cuts discrete levels.
You can also reference a ramp texture for better artistic control.
You can also reference a ramp texture for better artistic control.
The UIComponent <g1>RootElement</g1>  property has been replaced with the <g2>Page</g2> property.
The UIComponent <g1>RootElement</g1>  property has been replaced with the <g2>Page</g2> property.
It now expects an instance of the <g3>UIPage</g3> type.
It now expects an instance of the <g3>UIPage</g3> type.
Scripts that were setting the <g4>RootElement</g4> property need to be updated:
Scripts that were setting the <g4>RootElement</g4> property need to be updated:
Due to the slight API and behavior changes made to UI system, you might have to adapt some other part of your code.
Due to the slight API and behavior changes made to UI system, you might have to adapt some other part of your code.

Added a <g1>DebugConsoleSystem</g1> to be able to print basic debug information in game.
Added a <g1>DebugConsoleSystem</g1> to be able to print basic debug information in game.
Animation blend trees can now be created in script.
Animation blend trees can now be created in script.
The <g1>AnimationBlend</g1> pre-built script shows how to do it easily
The <g1>AnimationBlend</g1> pre-built script shows how to do it easily
Yaml scene files now encode entity and component references in a much more compact way
Yaml scene files now encode entity and component references in a much more compact way
Yaml serialization order is now following class declaration order
Yaml serialization order is now following class declaration order
Game studio side: added hard limits in Compression ratio, also now it is using a slider.
Game studio side: added hard limits in Compression ratio, also now it is using a slider.
Added <g1>SetRange</g1> in <g2>SoundInstance</g2> to be able to set play range, it also enables seeking.
Added <g1>SetRange</g1> in <g2>SoundInstance</g2> to be able to set play range, it also enables seeking.
Added <g1>Position</g1> property in <g2>SoundInstance</g2> to be able to know the position in time of your playing instance.
Added <g1>Position</g1> property in <g2>SoundInstance</g2> to be able to know the position in time of your playing instance.
Added <g1>PlayAndForget</g1> to <g2>AudioEmitterSoundController</g2> to play many instances of the same sound rapidly.
Added <g1>PlayAndForget</g1> to <g2>AudioEmitterSoundController</g2> to play many instances of the same sound rapidly.
Added RequestedAudioDevice in AudioSystem to allow game code to select audio devices (Windows only for now).
Added RequestedAudioDevice in AudioSystem to allow game code to select audio devices (Windows only for now).
<g1>AudioEmitterComponent</g1> now contains a dictionary of sounds that can be used from the emitter, those can be set from the Game Studio directly!
<g1>AudioEmitterComponent</g1> now contains a dictionary of sounds that can be used from the emitter, those can be set from the Game Studio directly!
Game Studio sound preview now uses the internal engine, this means that you can directly preview the compression rate!
Game Studio sound preview now uses the internal engine, this means that you can directly preview the compression rate!
CommandList can now compiled and executed
CommandList can now compiled and executed
Constant Buffers are now uploaded in a single GPU Buffer and set with offsets on platform/API that support this mode
Constant Buffers are now uploaded in a single GPU Buffer and set with offsets on platform/API that support this mode
D3D12: reduced number of API calls
D3D12: reduced number of API calls
Added preliminary controller vibration support with <g1>Input.SetGamePadVibration</g1>
Added preliminary controller vibration support with <g1>Input.SetGamePadVibration</g1>
Particle rendering now uses the improved multithreaded pipeline, significantly speeding up the vertex buffer building.
Particle rendering now uses the improved multithreaded pipeline, significantly speeding up the vertex buffer building.
Particles and Physics samples have been greatly reduced and merged into only two, which allows the user to check more features with a single sample.
Particles and Physics samples have been greatly reduced and merged into only two, which allows the user to check more features with a single sample.
Procedural models can now be used as a source to generate convex hull shapes.
Procedural models can now be used as a source to generate convex hull shapes.
We are now using the github version of Bullet Physics and actively cooperating with the project.
We are now using the github version of Bullet Physics and actively cooperating with the project.
Credential dialog will now save the credential settings when closing.
Credential dialog will now save the credential settings when closing.

Credential dialog will not appear if you checked "Do not ask again".
Fix hang when launching a Linux game remotely.
Fix hang when launching a Linux game remotely.
The UIComponent expect a UI Page in place of the previous Root Element property.
The UIComponent expect a UI Page in place of the previous Root Element property.
Most dependency properties were changed into regular C# properties, except the ones that are attached properties (such as the Column and Row attached property of a Grid).
Most dependency properties were changed into regular C# properties, except the ones that are attached properties (such as the Column and Row attached property of a Grid).
In desktop, TouchMove event is also raised when no mouse button are pressed.

Default style of the UI has been removed.
